title: Embroidery: Crewel Wool, early 18th century
medium:
Medium: cotton, linen, wool
Technique: embroidery on twill weave
description: Panel of cream linen warp and cotton weft, twill, (Width of goods about 19 1/2") embroidered in many-colored wools in long and short stitch: two upright cornucopias with inward-curling ends, out of which grow life-sized, naturalisticgarden flowers: carnations, morning-glories, jonquils, violets, pinks, roses and buds, campanula, ragged robin, a sunflower, etc. The whole enframed by thin green scrolling lines. From chair back.

tombstone.epitaph:
Embroidery: Crewel Wool, early 18th century.Medium: cotton, linen, wool
Technique: embroidery on twill weave. 1960-200-1.
